title: How to Create Prison Tattoo Ink
steps: Put the tattoo powder into a small cap or container.
Add water.
Finish mixing the ink.

title: How to Make Tattoo Ink from Ashes
steps: Try to find an alternative.
Get a clean bowl that is fireproof.
Get clean white paper (biodegradable is best).
Burn the paper in the bowl and collect the ash (make sure there is no wind).
Add water and mix with the ash (this is tricky - you have to use equal parts to make an ink water-like, but still thick enough to stick to your pin).
Dip the pin in your ink like a quill, and tattoo.

title: How to Make Tattoo Ink
steps: Gather your supplies.
Wash your hands.
Make your needle.
Heat your needle.
Draw your design.
Ink your needle.
Apply the ink to your skin.
Take care of your tattoo.
Touch up the design of your tattoo.

title: How to Get the Best Custom Tattoo
steps: Be specific.
Look at tattoos around you.
Visit the shop and look at their photos.
Have a bit of flexibility.
Consider when the photos were taken.
Try online.
Ask about their work.
Meet their customers.
Treat them with respect and pay their top dollar fee.
If you cannot travel, don't give up.

title: How to Prepare for a Tattoo
steps: Think about a design.
Consult with a tattoo artist.
Think about placement.
Consider the pain.
Prepare for aftercare.

title: How to Get a Tan Tattoo
steps: Wash and dry the area where the tattoo will go.
Paint a design onto the skin with nail polish.
Let the nail polish dry before heading out into the sunshine.
Go tan in the sun.

title: How to Start a Sleeve Tattoo
steps: Try hanging an image above your bed before getting it tattooed.
Make sure a sleeve won't impact your job prospects.
Start your sleeve when you’re ready to spend some money.

title: How to Design a Tattoo Sleeve
steps: Look at several artists’ work to decide who you want to collaborate with.
Meet with any potential artists first.
Work with your tattoo artist on finalizing the sleeve design.

title: How to Shade a Tattoo
steps: Fire up your tattoo machine.
Leave time between lining and shading.
Use Vaseline throughout the process.
Work in a circular motion.
Wipe off excess ink as you go.
Change the depth of the shade by adjusting the weight of your technique.
Dilute the ink as needed.
Change the ink capacity in the needle mouth when necessary.
Clean the needles as you go.

title: How to Cover a Tattoo Without Makeup
steps: Consult a tattoo artist to plan your new tattoo.
Choose a design that will cover your old tattoo completely.
Choose dark colors that will most effectively cover your old tattoo.
Fade the darkest lines of your old tattoo before getting your new tattoo.
Moisturize and protect your new cover up tattoo.

title: How to Sleep with a New Tattoo
steps: Wear loose clothing that doesn't rub against the tattoo.
Arrange pillows under your knees to make sleeping on your back more comfortable.
Put a pillow under your chest if you need to sleep on your belly.
Place pillows in front and behind you if you're sleeping on your side.
Sleep alone for the first few nights after getting the tattoo.
Create a soothing bedtime routine before you go to sleep.

title: How to Practice Tattooing
steps: Watch a professional use a machine first.
Practice on fruit.
Consider synthetic skin.
Purchase pig skin for a realistic practice experience.
Tattoo to the correct depth.
Give yourself a tattoo.

title: How to Use Tattoo Transfer Paper
steps: Prepare the surface of your craft.
Print your chosen images on printable tattoo paper.
Apply the included adhesive to your image.
Peel the clear plastic film off the image.
Place the image picture-side down on your craft.
Moisten the back of the image with a wet towel.
Peel the backing paper off gently.
Seal the image with a glaze spray.
Finished.

title: How to Choose a Tattoo Design
steps: Get a retro nautical tattoo.
Choose a flower tattoo.
Go for an elegant abstract design.

title: How to Cover a Tattoo with Makeup

Get an airbrush tan.

title: How to Create an Impressive Tattoo Artist Portfolio
steps: Buy an attractive portfolio folder.
Offer a variety of different types of art, to demonstrate an ability to work with different mediums.
Offer a wide variety of subjects.
Clearly present your style within your portfolio.
Show the stages of your work.
Include a page, or even a few pages, of flash tattoo designs that you have created at the back of your portfolio.
Create a visual CV.
Your portfolio is now complete!.
